item.title: She Is Most Googled Person In India In 2024, Chirag Paswan Is Third - NDTV
item.description:
Vinesh Phogat Named Most Googled Person in India for 2024

Publication Date: June 9, 2024 Source: NDTV

According to a Google Trends report, Olympian wrestler Vinesh Phogat emerged as the most Googled person in India in 2024, reflecting a year marked by significant highs and lows in her career.

  • Vinesh Phogat, an Olympian wrestler and newly-elected Congress MLA, topped the list of most searched Indians.
  • The second most-searched individual was Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, followed by Chirag Paswan in third place.
  • Searches for Kumar and Paswan peaked during the Lok Sabha election counting day.
  • Phogat experienced a shocking disqualification at the Paris Olympics but rebounded with victory in the Haryana elections.
  • Cricketer Hardik Pandya and Pawan Kalyan, an actor-turned-politician, also featured prominently in the searches.
  • Other notable entries included model Poonam Pandey and badminton star Laksha Sena.
‚ÄúThis year has been a journey of heartbreak and new beginnings,‚Äù Vinesh Phogat on her tumultuous year.

The trends indicate a blend of sports, politics, and entertainment defining the public's search interests in India for 2024.

item.title: Cheteshwar Pujara Gives Brutal Verdict On Rohit Sharma's Dismal Form: "He Should Have..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Pujara Critiques Rohit Sharma's Batting Position Amid Struggles

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Cheteshwar Pujara has commented on Rohit Sharma's performance issues during the Test series against Australia, emphasizing the challenges posed by batting in the middle order.

  • Pujara highlights Rohit's poor shot selection and mental pressure due to a lack of runs.
  • Rohit has been dismissed six times by Pat Cummins in 12 innings this series.
  • The captain has shifted from an opening role to batting at No. 6, adding to his struggles.
  • Pujara believes that adjusting to a new batting position has affected Rohit‚Äôs performance.
‚ÄúHe should have defended that ball, allowed the ball to come to him rather than going for that ball.‚Äù - Cheteshwar Pujara

Pujara's insights shed light on the importance of batting order and its impact on performance, particularly for experienced players like Rohit Sharma.

item.title: Watch: Virat Kohli perfectly sets up Travis Head dismissal, convinces Rohit Sharma to... - The Times of India
item.description:
Watch: Virat Kohli perfectly sets up Travis Head dismissal, convinces Rohit Sharma to...

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

In the thrilling third Test between India and Australia at the Gabba, Virat Kohli devises a strategic plan that leads to Travis Head's dismissal, showcasing his cricketing intellect.

  • Virat Kohli suggested a tactical bowling approach to Rohit Sharma during India's innings.
  • Kohli encouraged bowling from over the wicket to catch Travis Head off-guard.
  • The planned delivery was executed by Mohammed Siraj, resulting in a successful dismissal.
  • Travis Head managed to score 17 runs before being caught out by Rishabh Pant.
‚ÄúNahi, nahi. Over se agar scrambled waala dalega middle stump se toh out hone ka chance hai.‚Äù - Virat Kohli

The strategic intervention by Kohli not only demonstrates his leadership but also emphasizes the importance of teamwork in cricket.

item.title: Updated World Test Championship Table After India vs Australia Brisbane Test Ends In A Draw - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Updated World Test Championship Table After India vs Australia Brisbane Test Ends In A Draw

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: NDTV

India secured a vital draw against Australia in the rain-affected third Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, keeping the series level at 1-1.

  • Both teams saw their WTC points percentages dip, with India now at 55.88% and Australia at 58.89%.
  • South Africa leads the standings with a 63.33% PCT and is well-positioned for the WTC final in June 2025.
  • India must win both remaining Tests against Australia to stay in contention for the final.
  • The outcome of matches involving Sri Lanka will also influence India's chances of qualification.
If India wins each of the remaining Tests, their PCT could rise to 60.52, surpassing Australia even with a 2-0 victory against Sri Lanka.

In conclusion, India‚Äôs path to the WTC final requires winning both Tests against Australia, while relying on external results to bolster their chances.

item.title: 'You'll get me killed...': Rohit's slip of tongue on 'Rahane, Pujara retirement' after Ashwin news floors reporters - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Slip of Tongue After Ashwin's Retirement Shocks Reporters

Published on: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

India captain Rohit Sharma faced a challenging moment during a post-match conference after Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket.

  • Rohit clarified that Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara have not yet retired and have future possibilities with the team.
  • The remarks were made following the conclusion of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series, which ended in a draw.
  • Ashwin retires with 537 wickets in Tests, the second-highest for India.
‚ÄúLet me clarify, Rahane has not retired. You'll get me killed. Pujara, too, hasn't retired.‚Äù - Rohit Sharma

This incident highlights the pressures and challenges faced by players in high-stakes situations, especially regarding sensitive announcements like retirements.

item.title: Rohit Sharma gives big update on Mohammed Shami‚Äôs availability for remaining two Australia Tests - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Provides Update on Mohammed Shami's Availability for Australia Tests

Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian captain Rohit Sharma has shared important details regarding pacer Mohammed Shami's potential participation in the final two Tests against Australia, expressing the need for updates from the National Cricket Academy.

  • Rohit emphasizes the importance of ensuring Shami's fitness for the remaining Tests.
  • Shami is currently in rehabilitation after ankle surgery and needs clearance from the NCA.
  • The third Test ended in a draw, making the series tied at 1-1.
  • The next match will be held at the MCG starting December 26.
‚ÄúThe last thing you want is the player coming here and then pulling out in the middle of the game.‚Äù - Rohit Sharma

The Indian team management is keen on Shami's return but will only consider it upon receiving confirmation from the NCA regarding his fitness.

item.title: "He is a feisty character and we need such guys in the team": Rohit Sharma praises India's newest match saver against Australia - Crictoday
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Praises Akash Deep for His Match-Saving Performance Against Australia

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

The third Test between India and Australia ended in a draw due to rain interruptions. Australia dominated most of the match, but a standout innings from Akash Deep helped India avoid the follow-on. Rohit Sharma praised Akash in a press conference following the match.

  • India needed 33 runs to avoid the follow-on when Akash and Jasprit Bumrah were batting.
  • Akash scored 31 runs off 44 balls, helping India reach 260 runs.
  • Rohit Sharma praised Akash, saying, "He always gives 100 percent and is a spicy character. We want such guys in the team."
‚ÄúHe always gives 100 percent and is a spicy character. We want such guys in the team, who can contribute in all the departments.‚Äù - Rohit Sharma

The match ended with Australia declaring their second innings at 89/7, leaving India with a target of 275 runs, but rain interrupted the play.

item.title: "He is a spicy character and we need such guys in the team": Rohit Sharma praises India's newest match saver against Australia - Crictoday
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Cummins praises openers' 'contributions' as selectors mull options - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Cummins Defends Openers as Australia Selectors Consider Changes

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia captain Pat Cummins has backed his opening batters amid scrutiny following a rain-affected draw, as selectors prepare for two crucial tests in the series.

  • Selectors to meet for final two Tests after draw leaves series tied at 1-1.
  • Discussion on extra bowling cover for injured Josh Hazlewood with Scott Boland likely to be included.
  • Usman Khawaja and Nathan McSweeney struggled against India‚Äôs bowling attack, failing to score significant runs.
  • Calls for 19-year-old Sam Konstas after his impressive performances in the Big Bash League.
  • Cummins emphasizes the contributions of his top three batters despite low individual scores.
‚ÄúI think the trend in world cricket is the top three is a really hard place to bat at the moment. Particularly here in Australia, the wickets are tough.‚Äù - Pat Cummins

Cummins remains supportive of McSweeney‚Äôs efforts despite his lack of runs, highlighting the challenges faced by openers and the importance of their role in stabilizing the innings.

item.title: Cummins' updates: Starc and he 'are feeling really good'; Head 'will be fine' for MCG - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Cummins' updates: Starc and he 'are feeling really good'; Head 'will be fine' for MCG

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia's cricket team is optimistic about Travis Head's fitness for the upcoming Boxing Day Test against India, following concerns over a tight quad he experienced during the previous match.

  • Travis Head is expected to play despite recent tightness in his quad.
  • Captain Pat Cummins stated, "Trav, he'll be fine, it's a bit of a tight quad, he'll be fine for Melbourne."
  • Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out for the remainder of the series due to a calf strain.
  • Despite concerns, Head's performance has been vital, having scored consecutive centuries.
  • The selectors are set to meet to finalize the team ahead of the Test.
"It's really tough," Cummins said regarding Hazlewood's multiple injuries. "He's probably one of the most disciplined, professional sportspeople you could meet."

Overall, Australia's focus remains on ensuring Head's recovery while managing the squad dynamics in the absence of Hazlewood.

item.title: What does Brisbane draw against Australia mean for India's WTC final chances - Hindustan Times
item.description:
What does Brisbane draw against Australia mean for India's WTC final chances

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The draw at the Gabba keeps India in the third spot of the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with a PCT of 58.88 after 17 matches. Persistent rain forced the match to conclude in a draw, impacting India's chances for the WTC final.

  • The match ended in a draw due to rain after India began their chase of 275 runs.
  • India cannot afford another draw or loss in their remaining two matches to stay in contention for the WTC final.
  • Winning 3-1 in the remaining series would ensure India's qualification without depending on other results.
  • The draw maintains tight competition in the WTC standings, with Australia and South Africa also in contention.
The draw did keep India still in the hunt for a spot in the WTC final, but they have now entered a must-win territory.

Overall, while India remains in contention for the World Test Championship final, they must secure victories in their upcoming matches to guarantee qualification.

item.title: WTC standings: Draw in Gabba leaves India, Australia's fates in balance - The Times of India
item.description:
WTC standings: Draw in Gabba leaves India, Australia's fates in balance

Date: [Publication Date]

Source: [Source Name]

The Brisbane Test between Australia and India ended in a draw due to persistent rain, leaving the World Test Championship final race wide open.

  • Both teams were affected by rain throughout the match, thwarting a clear victory.
  • India needed 275 runs to win after Australia declared their innings at 89/7.
  • The series remains tied at 1-1, with both teams gaining four points towards WTC qualification.
  • South Africa leads the WTC standings, while Australia and India are closely competing for a place in the final.
The unpredictable December weather in Brisbane thwarted both teams' attempts to secure a victory.

This drawn match underscores the competitive nature of the current WTC race, with crucial matches still ahead for both teams.

item.title: R Ashwin retires: Emotional scenes, a warm hug as Rohit Sharma bids good bye to his teammate - The Times of India
item.description:
R Ashwin Retires: Emotional Scenes, a Warm Hug as Rohit Sharma Bids Goodbye to His Teammate

Date: Brisbane

Source: Times of India

R Ashwin has officially announced his retirement from international cricket, marking the end of an incredible career. Alongside his captain Rohit Sharma, Ashwin shared an emotional farewell moment with his long-time teammate.

  • Ashwin's announcement came with a heartfelt hug from Rohit Sharma.
  • He expressed gratitude to the BCCI and his fellow players during this tough moment.
  • The announcement occurred following a hard-fought draw against Australia.
  • Ashwin finished his Test career with an impressive total of 537 wickets.
"I had a lot of fun with this team. Would like to thank the BCCI, players and coaches I played with." - R Ashwin

This retirement marks a significant moment for Indian cricket as the team bids farewell to one of its outstanding players.

item.title: Updated WTC 2023-25 Points Table After India-Australia 3rd Test Ends In A Draw - News18
item.description:
Updated WTC 2023-25 Points Table After India-Australia 3rd Test Ends In A Draw

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: News18

The third Test between India and Australia at The Gabba concluded in a draw, prompting changes in the WTC points table. India retains its No. 3 position but sees a drop in its PCT%.

  • The Test match was affected by rain, with India scoring 260 runs in response to Australia's 445.
  • Both teams earned 4 WTC points from the draw.
  • India's PCT% slipped from 57.29 to 55.88, while Australia's decreased from 60.71 to 58.89.
  • South Africa leads the WTC points table with a PCT% of 63.33.
‚ÄúBoth India and Australia have to settle with 4 World Test Championship (WTC) points each.‚Äù

In summary, the draw has implications for the rankings but does not significantly alter the standings for India and Australia in their WTC campaign.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test, Day 5 Highlights: Big Blow To WTC Final Hopes As India vs Australia 3rd Test Ends In A Draw - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test, Day 5 Highlights: Big Blow To WTC Final Hopes As India vs Australia 3rd Test Ends In A Draw

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: NDTV

Incessant rainfall in Brisbane led to the third Test between India and Australia finishing in a draw. India lost their last wicket and removed seven wickets of Australia before the hosts declared their innings at 89. With India needing 275 runs to win, the play was called off with them at 8/0.

Key Points:

  • The match was severely affected by weather conditions, leading to no result.
  • India and Australia are now level in the five-match series at 1-1.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal and KL Rahul opened for India, scoring 4 runs each before play ceased.
‚ÄúGoing to Melbourne at 1-1 pretty much gives us that confidence to go out there and pull things towards us.‚Äù - Rohit Sharma

The next match is the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, where both teams will strive to secure a lead in the series.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin announces retirement from international cricket - The Hindu
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin Announces Retirement from International Cricket

Published: December 18, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

India‚Äôs ace spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket on December 18, 2024, after the third Test match against Australia in Brisbane.

  • Ashwin made the announcement during the post-match press conference.
  • He stated, "This will be my last day as an Indian cricketer in all formats in the international level."
  • Ashwin finishes his Test career with 537 wickets at an average of 24 in 106 matches.
  • The BCCI expressed gratitude for his contributions on social media.
‚ÄúThank You Ashwin ü´° A name synonymous with mastery, wizardry, brilliance, and innovation üëèüëè Congratulations on a legendary career, @ashwinravi99 ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù

This marks the end of an era for a player who has had significant influence in Indian cricket.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin announces retirement from international cricket after Gabba Test - The Indian Express
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin Announces Retirement from International Cricket

Publication Date: December 18, 2024
Source: Indian Express

India‚Äôs premier spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket following the third Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test in Brisbane. His retirement announcement came after a rain break during Day 5, where he shared an emotional moment with Virat Kohli.

  • Ashwin concludes a notable 14-year career, having taken 537 wickets in Test matches, making him India's second-highest Test wicket-taker.
  • He has recorded 37 Test five-fors and was part of India's World Cup-winning squad in 2011.
  • Ashwin plans to continue his cricketing journey in club-level competitions and the IPL.
‚ÄúThis will be my last day as an Indian cricketer in all formats at the international level,‚Äù - Ravichandran Ashwin

Ashwin will continue to contribute in franchise cricket and has rejoined the Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2025.

item.description:
Gabba draw leaves World Test Championship race in the balance

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

India faced a challenging chase of 275 runs promised by Australia‚Äôs quick declaration, but the match ended in a draw due to inclement weather, impacting the World Test Championship standings significantly.

  • Australia declared their second innings at 89/7.
  • India was dismissed for 260 in their first innings.
  • Weather interruptions led to the play being called off.

‚ÄúOngoing storms in the area saw play called off after tea,‚Äù encapsulating the match's abrupt end.

With both teams now positioned closely in the standings, the next matches will be critical as they seek to secure their places in the final.

BBL 2024-2025: Match 4, STA vs HEA Match Prediction

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: CricTracker

The Melbourne Stars face the Brisbane Heat in Match 4 of the BBL 2024-25 season at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. The Stars are looking for redemption after a defeat in their season opener against the Perth Scorchers.

  • The Stars scored 146/9 against the Scorchers, suffering a six-wicket loss.
  • Cooper Connolly was a standout for the Scorchers, scoring 64 runs.
  • The Heat are coming off a strong previous season where they won their second BBL title.
  • The match will help the Heat establish their momentum for the new season.
  • Pitch at MCG is considered sporting, aiding both batters and bowlers.

In today's match prediction, the team batting first is likely to win.

item.title: Warnie the oracle: Late legend proved right again over big issue with Aussie summer - Fox Sports
item.description:
Warnie the oracle: Late legend proved right again over big issue with Aussie summer

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Fox Sports

The article discusses how Cricket Australia should have heeded the advice of the late Shane Warne regarding scheduling Tests in Australia during the summer. Poor weather led to significant delays in the third Test, and Warne had previously suggested moving the Brisbane Test to avoid rain issues.

  • The third Test in Brisbane faced numerous rain delays, likely ending in a draw.
  • Shane Warne had advocated for scheduling changes to avoid bad weather impacting Test matches.
  • The Sydney Test has historically suffered from rain, with calls to move it to earlier in the summer.
  • Cricket Australia announced the SCG Test schedule won't change until 2030.
  • Gabba will not host a Test in the 2026-27 summer for the first time in decades.
  • Warne's predictions in cricket often prove accurate, highlighting his insightful understanding of the game.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs better weather (at the start of the season) than it is in the first week of January,‚Äù - Shane Warne

In conclusion, the article emphasizes the foresight of Warne and the ongoing challenges faced by Cricket Australia in scheduling Tests to ensure a fair and uninterrupted game.

item.title: Rohit Sharma 'himself will step down if doesn't score' in last two Tests against Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma 'himself will step down if doesn't score' in last two Tests against Australia

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's captain Rohit Sharma continues to struggle for runs in Australia, leading to speculation about his future as skipper.

  • Rohit has faced criticism for his performance, having scored low runs in recent matches.
  • Sunil Gavaskar suggests Rohit may choose to resign if he fails to score in the remaining two Tests.
  • Rohit shifted to batting in the middle order, impacting his confidence according to teammate Cheteshwar Pujara.
‚ÄúIf he hasn't scored runs, my feeling is that he himself will take the call,‚Äù said Gavaskar.

Overall, if Rohit does not regain form quickly, he may face pressure to step down as captain.
